1.title: Hunting for Vintage Baltimore
1.plot: A Baltimore couple has decided that their first home has to be vintage. But navigating the city's ample supply of stately Colonials, Civil War row houses and Victorian charmers won't be easy.

2.title: Newlyweds Searching for Vintage Charm in Sacramento, California
2.plot: A newlywed couple wants to buy a piece of history in Sacramento, California.

3.title: Family Looking for a Home with a History in Arkansas
3.plot: A family of three looks for a vintage home in historic Hot Springs, Arkansas.

5.title: Fashion Designer Wants Vintage Conch Style Home in Key West, Florida
5.plot: A fashion designer wants to find a vintage Conch-style home in Key West, Florida.

6.title: Wilmington, North Carolina Couple Seeks Vintage Home to Raise Family
6.plot: An interior designer and her husband are looking for a vintage home in Wilmington, North Carolina, where they can put down roots and raise their family. She wants a large white Colonial that reminds her of the house in the movie "Father of the Bride." He loves handcrafted architectural details, so he's hoping to find a Craftsman. But they also want a modern, open kitchen and a big backyard for the kids -- features that can be hard to find in vintage houses.

7.title: Windy City Natives Search for Their Vintage Dream Home in Chicago, Illinois
7.plot: Dionne and Jamada are in the market for the charm and quality a vintage Chicago home can offer. Dionne's love for vintage started with her love for thrift shops, while Jamada's passion and respect for vintage is a result of being a professional carpenter. While Dionne loves the feminine details and 'doll house' look of Victorians, Jamada wants something more masculine and sturdy looking like a Tudor. But with a $250,000 budget, will they find the perfect vintage home that satisfies both of their needs? Or will their dreams be whisked away in the bluster of the Windy ...

8.title: Family Searches for Vintage Charm in San Francisco
8.plot: Greg, Lance and their daughter Sophie are searching for a vintage home in the pricey bay area of San Francisco, with its rich architectural history and diverse neighborhoods. They want something from the Victorian or Edwardian era with a large backyard, original vintage light fixtures and a garage. But Greg doesn't want their daughter to endure project after project, while Lance is excited to take on renovations. With a $2,500,000 budget, will Greg and Lance find their perfect vintage home or lose their way in a real estate fog by the bay?

9.title: Vintage Home Wanted in Indiana
9.plot: A Bloomington, Indiana, couple searches for a vintage house, but they don't agree on what style they want.

10.title: Hunting for Vintage in Springfield, Massachusetts
10.plot: New England couple Edwin and Lillian are obsessed with vintage, and that has brought them to Springfield, Massachusetts, which is known for its extensive vintage architecture. However, these old house enthusiasts don't exactly agree on what their dream home looks like: Edwin loves Colonials and Tudors, while Lillian swoons for Victorians. Edwin has his sights set on modern kitchens and bathrooms, but Lillian wants original fixtures and features. Will they find a perfect piece of vintage property they both can agree on? Or will one of them have to compromise before the...

11.title: Midcentury Modern in Palm Springs, Ca
11.plot: Buyers with a love of midcentury modern architecture search for the perfect home in sunny Palm Springs, California. However one wants to see only original floor plans, while the other wants a home with contemporary features.

imdb.plot outline: Adventurous home seekers scour the country for a specific type of home to buy, vintage. From century-old Victorians, to timeless Brownstones and historic Four Squares, each episode will feature couples touring three properties in neighborhoods across the U.S. to find a house with the perfect heritage they seek. Find out which classic home they'll make their own on Hunting Vintage.
